definition: to save bit by bit/to accumulate

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing

sentences.english: All these records can add up to a nice stack of paper.
sentences.chinese: 所有的這些備份文件積攢起來便成了厚厚一堆紙。

sentences.english: For scrape up tuition, celebrate yuan removed a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 爲了積攢學費，慶元開起了出租車。

sentences.english: Encourage children to put aside some of their pocket-money to buy Christmas presents.
sentences.chinese: 應鼓勵孩子爲聖誕禮物而積攢自己的零用錢。

sentences.english: The collective wealth has been accumulated bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 集體的家業是一點一滴地積攢起來的。

sentences.english: When you stab yourself in the foot in hopes that it'll raise your rage bar faster.
sentences.chinese: 你猛戳自己的腳，希望能夠加快積攢一些怒氣。

sentences.english: With the capital he had saved, he converted the house into an orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 利用他積攢起來的資金，他把房子改造成一所孤兒院。

sentences.english: After five yea of hard work, he'd saved enough money to buy a new camera.
sentences.chinese: 他辛費力苦積攢了五年的錢買了一架照像機。

sentences.english: She had scraped together enough money for college.
sentences.chinese: 我積攢的錢可使我遇難不慌。

sentences.english: The heart has many words have been saved to say to you, where to start.
sentences.chinese: 心裏有許多話一直積攢着要對你說，要從哪裏開始呢。

sentences.english: The money I've saved is my security against hard times.
sentences.chinese: 我積攢的錢可使我遇難不慌。

sentences.english: He saved like a lunatic squirrel for a new ice age .
sentences.chinese: 他很象一隻爲防備新冰川期來臨而積攢糧食的松鼠。

sentences.english: Therefore, inflation factor should be taken into consideration in the planning.
sentences.chinese: 所以教育金積攢要考慮到通脹的因素。

sentences.english: It adds up little by little.
sentences.chinese: 它是一點一點積攢起來的。

sentences.english: Liang's initial capital was the 70, 000-yuan "lucky money" that he had saved over the years.
sentences.chinese: 梁昊的原始資本是他積攢多年的7萬元“壓歲錢”。
